lexUnit.name: split.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: divide or cause to divide into parts or groups.

sentence.text: Mr Brian Watson , chief executive of the Driver and Vehicle Agency , is to split the money between Action Cancer and the Northern Ireland Chest Heart and Stroke Association .
Charman felt it should be split four ways between each band member , but Gedge thought he should have most of it because he had actually written the songs .
He is splitting his huge donation between four charities , including UK-based Oxfam and the United Nations High Commission for Refugees .
Behind them the wind split a bough from a tree with a sharp crack .

It was only three years ago that we split our business from Healthcare and we really are a stand-alone Division now , particularly with the advent of M.S.I.L. [ Medical Services Incineration Limited ] .
Some of the contracts have been straight business deals whereby the Provisionals and the property owners split the profit from the government compensation .
Split the cake in half horizontally and sandwich together again with some of the buttercream .
So they decided to split the house in two . "
Men fighting in the field depended on the votes of men splitting straws in Washington .
This is then used to split water into hydrogen and oxygen , creating a fuel which is portable , cheap and very clean .
Harvey split the words into syllables and made each syllable a step in his dance , then he changed the accents round and danced the same remark again .
The young men split the cattle into two groups and head off to find pasture .
The War was over , Rutherford split the atom on 3 January 1919 , and the workers ' war had just begun .
And so comes the baleful conclusion : that Vietnam , a war that split America apart on class lines , continues to be a national sore , causing a steady throb of pain .
The cut of the assassin 's sword had split it from below the shoulder to the hem .
The bookmakers offered less , racing demanded more and the government-appointed members of the Levy Board , which distributes the money , failed to persuade the two parties to split the difference .
The whole place is a shambles of falling rock , soft shaly rock , slaty rock ; everything has been split apart by erosion .
Not quickly enough , however , and once again the night was split by flame and thunder as fire-sticks had roared terrifyingly close to them .
Splitting the group up into small parties , each led by a parent who already has children at the school is a useful idea .
A detachment represents a body of troops that has been split off from the rest of their regiment and armed as small , independent units whose role is to operate within sight of their regiment .
The old Soviet armed forces should be split up between the new states , not consolidated under the flag of St Andrew .
Our section was split up into four groups , each under the command of a Sergeant and two Corporals .
In Russia the children will be split up and sent to different orphanges .
If you split the firm up you will have a lot of small firms each producing at higher average cost , a waste of society 's resources .
Later that century the Empire was finally split up into an eastern and a western part .
